data.prayer: Father, help the 2,039 believers in Alger to know your commands and to do them.
data.verse: For Ezra had devoted himself to the study and observance of the Law of the Lord, and to teaching its decrees and laws in Israel.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Alger, Algeria
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Father, please help good, online teachers get the gospel on YouTube and into the the state of Alger.
data.verse: And this gospel of the kingdom will be preached in the whole world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come.

data.section_summary: On average, 160 people will die without Jesus in the next 100 hours in Alger, Algeria.
data.prayer: Jesus, send your gospel to these.
Father, we pray the believers are good spiritual stewards of their everyday relationships in Alger, Algeria.
Spirit, help the 2,039 believers in Alger to start simple multiplying churches in their homes.

Lord, bring the blind by a way that they don’t know. Lead the Arab, Iraqi people in paths that they don’t know. Make darkness light before them and crooked places straight. Do not forsake the Arab, Iraqi people.
Spirit, teach those feeling unsafe in Alger, Algeria that they can hide under your wings
data.verse: He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness will be your shield and rampart.

data.prayer: Lord, for the leaders in the state of Alger, let the eyes of their hearts be enlightened in order that they may know the hope to which they are called.
data.verse: I pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened in order that you may know the hope to which he has called you, the riches of his glorious inheritance in his holy people, and his incomparably great power for us who believe.

data.prayer: Father, help your children in Alger, Algeria find someone like the Samaritan Woman today. Someone who will open an entire town to your message of salvation.
data.verse: So the woman left her water jar and went away into town and said to the people, 29 “Come, see a man who told me all that I ever did. Can this be the Christ?” They went out of the town and were coming to him.
